page.title: 10BURGHLEY:DAIRY FARM
page.content: At the dairy farm there is an old stone building probably used for storage.The shape of the building is rectangular.The roof is thatched with a window in it.The stone is very old.Mr.Barnes rents the farm.It used to be called the dairy farm but now they have no cattle.The buildings consisted of the main farm house,a stone cottage,a wooden bungalow,cattle sheds,a thatched stable and a stone barn.Then we walked through an archway to the gamekeepers cottage.At the gamekeepers cottage there is a hatchery for pheasants.We looked at the incubator.The eggs have to stay in it for 21 days.They hatch 3 days later.After they have hatched they are put into pens where they stay for 16 weeks.They are put into a big pen in the wood and released into the wild.
